creator: oliver.grass@systor.com
text:
Hi,

we're using log4j for the logging from an EJB. I want to log all transactions 
from one day and then rollover to the next day. So i decided to use the 
DailyRollingFileAppender...
I'm working with WinNT 4.0, JDK 1.3.1...

I want the log-files to be in a specified directory, so let's assume c:/temp..
The following is a snippet from my config-file
------------------------------------------------------------
log4j.appender.logfile=org.apache.log4j.DailyRollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.logfile.File=c:/temp/gateway.log
log4j.appender.logfile.DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm
------------------------------------------------------------

For testing purposes i'm using the per-minute-rollover...
If i specify the File without any directory, for example just
log4j.appender.logfile.File=gateway.log
everything works fine, except that the log-file is placed in the current working
directory. But when i specify a directory in front of the logfile like above, 
the file is overwritten every minute...
I tried several possibilities like c:\\temp\\gateway.log or 
c://temp//gateway.log. I even tried a relative path, but nothing worked...

I know, that i could eventually fix this problem, but i think this should be 
fixed in a new version of log4j....

thanx
Oliver

BTW: the same problem occurs with the RollingFileAppender, if the maximum size 
is reached.

Maybe a solution to this bug?

Hi guys,

when using the Unix-like path-identifiers it seems to work...
------------------------------------------------------------
log4j.appender.logfile=org.apache.log4j.DailyRollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.logfile.File=${user.dir}/gateway.log
log4j.appender.logfile.DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm
------------------------------------------------------------

The user.dir-variable is passed to the EJB-Server on startup
-Duser.dir=c:\temp\

This is working fine, but i'm still thinking, that this can only be a workaround 
and that there is still a problem.

regards...
Oliver
